thread.title: USWNT star Christen Press gets new gig hosting web show
thread.title_full: USWNT star Christen Press gets new gig hosting web show

author: paulmbanks
title: USWNT star Christen Press gets new gig hosting web show
text:
Tweet 
Starting this weekend at the Rose Bowl , U.S. Women’s National Team forward and Chicago Red Stars franchise player Christen Press will host the soccer themed segments on FOX Sports digital series, @The Buzzer. 
Press hails from Palos Verdes, California and with FOX being headquartered in Los Angeles, it’s convenient for everyone involved. “Working with such a cool digital series like @TheBuzzer was such an attractive opportunity for me and I am so thrilled to be a part of it,” Christen Press said. “It’s great that I get to talk about the sport that I love, being on the other side of the camera, and help it grow in a new and different way.” Press will make 25 @TheBuzzer appearances through the end of the calendar year, working at FOX Sports’ digital studio in Los Angeles while continuing her training and full-time commitments to the U.S. Women’s National Team. It’s currently off season for the Red Stars and the National Women’s Soccer League. 
Here’s the Christen Press intro video: Press makes her @TheBuzzer debut as an embedded correspondent with the American Outlaws in Pasadena leading up to kickoff of the CONCACAF CUP between Mexico and the United States on Saturday. 
On the same exact day that this was announced, the Chicago Red Stars also published a Christen Press promotion. (Her publicity team is really busy today!) 
Press was named a member of the PAC-12 All-Century Women’s Soccer Team. 
Press (2007-10), a recent FIFA World Cup Champion and NWSL Best XI, completed her Stanford career as the 2010 NCAA leader in goals (26) and points (60). The awards continued to stack up for Press in her senior campaign, as she was the 2010 Hermann Trophy winner, 2010 Soccer America Player of the Year, 2010 PAC-10 Player of the Year and 2010 NSCAA first-team All-America. Paul M. Banks owns, operates and sometimes writes The Sports Bank.net , which is partnered with FOX Sports Engage Network. The website is also featured on News Now. Banks, a former writer for the Washington Times, currently contributes to the Chicago Tribune RedEye. He also appears regularly on numerous talk shows all across the country. Catch him Tuesdays on KOZN 1620 The Zone.
